text: Basically whenever a creature you control explores, put a +1/+1 counter on it and gain three life.
It's cheap enough. I'm not sure I care enough about the effects it generates, though...
It depends on how deep they go on explore,
No way they go deep enough to make it relevant for EDH
Ixalan is the last two set block, right. Everything from here on out is single large sets? Or is there one more block in the pipeline?
Yup...nope, this is it.
I agree with Dana.
That clue doubler is barely playable because they didn't go deep enough.
Ixalan is the last two block set where they committed to two blocks prior to development. They'll let the proccess dictate size from here on out
So a set could be two blocks if they feel it's justified
But they aren't doing it every time just to do it
You mean one set's story could bleed into the next set, but there are no more blocks after this.
<@U286Q175Y> I made it. I'm in special forces :smile:
I just couldn't remember if Ixalan was the last block or if there was one more.

For example now when they decided to return to Innistrad they went in knowing it would have two sets (making it a block). Now when they decide to go to Ravnica again they'll go into it and determine based on their ideas whether it supports more than one set
good job :smile:
Right, I know how they're working it going forward, I just couldn't recall the exact time line
It wouldn't surprise me to see the Return to Return to Ravnica be two sets
But most others just one

I do find it interesting how they're stressing that Ixalan as a set mostly takes place on one continent. Makes me wonder if that's so they can return to a plane in the future without being beholden to an existing storyline
They don't like to do that. It's the Dominaria problem. They want each world to be differentiated.
Those things aren't mutually exclusive though. You can keep the Ixlan flavor but set a story on a different continent so you aren't stuck dealing with any fallout from this block.
i wish they didnt have to tie it into some stupid asshole like jace
why cant it be like it use to be where it was more episodic
they are so lazy about the story imo
they probably come up with the idea like, carribbean pirate theme set! ok, how do we get jace here?
I think they're trying to re-create the Weatherlight Saga without actually understanding what people liked about it.
Jace as a character is basically taking the shittiest parts of Gerrard and mistaking those for the best parts.
Dana, I'd reference MaRo, but I think I established last night that I suck at remembering what he says.

I think MaRo take an unnecessary amount of shit, but he's certainly not without faults, and one of those faults is reading too much into Jace's popularity in their marketing and letting that dictate story. People eat way more Big Macs ever year than any other burger, but one should be cautious about reading too much into what that says about the quality of the Big Mac.
Huh
You were just talking about card draw in white <@U4V5EHQ2G>...
Yeah. That's a lot of work to get a Jayemdae Tome though
You can loot for half that
True, and you do get a swing in
and as a 2/10 it's unlikely to die
Plus it can tap for mana if need be, or be a six mana Regrowth
Love that it's target card vs. a specific type to retur
return, that is.
It's a late-game mana sink
I would imagine most Depala decks want it for sure
Each ability is relevant.
Mana sinks baked into a land is almost always useful
In Noyan Dhar (sp) he can turn it into a creature land and then Training Grounds drops the activated ability cost :wink:
It's a pretty huge flavor win as a card, too
It's like a planewalker land
Yeah, good point, if you're already running Training Grounds that's way more attractive to just blindly slot in
I wish they'd reprint Training Grounds...

I'm waiting for them to print "Jace's Sea Shanty", which would be an instant that forces each player to return a nonland permanent from the battlefield to hand, place another nonland permanent from hand to gy and return another nonland card from the gy to hand.
And it would have Rebound.
Because it's drunk Jace.
A really slow Maze of Ith
Feels pretty solid in Boros
Actually, paying 3 mana to get a shuffle can be worth it too.
Shuffle that gets you a land. That ain't nothing.
Five mana for the first use isn't great
Hey that's the item Vraska had in the 3rd story spotlight
Nope. Seems good.
Repeatable basic land search seems good though, even if slow
It isn't great on the first but in certain decks.
Given the cost I'm not sure it needed the tap clause.
Yet another reason Edgar should have been worked with knights too. Great card in that deck though.
Yup. Slots right in.
Flavor text is a little meh.
Might work in Licia nicely, too.
Possibly, though tribal doesn't make as much sense in her deck.
<@U3MTAQBE1> has an article on Licia going live today.
Also, that Maze land isn't as good as Maze because it has to be an opponent's creature.
Looking forward to it, I've really came around on her as a commander. Biggest problem with her will be the same as Oloro where people often don't understand how to use life as a resource
Or are afraid to
Yup...it's just another resource. That's what most folks don't understand is wrong with Oloro...free resources.
Most just look at 'oh, free life!', but even 2 life a turn isn't the key, it's the free resource the Oloro player can use a turn.
Yep. Two life isn't two life, it's a Greed activation, etc.
Indeed
Max once said on our podcast that Dromoka doesn't have lifegain, she has "keep every fucking card from Sylvan Library" as an ability. I always liked that.
Yup - or Phyrexian Arena becomes free card draw with no downside, minimize Mana Crypt triggers, etc.
The amount of Oloro decks not running Hatred always shocks me
The real key is free greed or Erebos draw triggers
Would you like to pay 2 mana to draw a card? Why yes, yes I would...
Yep
Someone should write an article about life as a resource and all the possibilities.
I'd be interested in a miniseries that discussed resources as a whole.
Mana, creatures, cards, players/opponents(politics), life, etc.
Everything is a resource.
your wife? resource.
Totally.
Your kids? Put em to work. They're a resource.
Usually a poor one...
The trick is to break their spirits and use them for simple, menial labor.
or for raw matrials
Typically making them scrub the bathroom with a toothbrush three times in a row will do it.
especially right after dean was in there
You don't know how right you are. I had my gallbladder removed. My digestion is all kinds of fucked up.
When mine was removed my doctor described it as a organic quarry
Yeah. Mine had so many they had to stretch the extraction hole. They weren't expecting that.
I've had zero digestive issues, though.
I like that maze of ith a lot
If you have 7 lands its basically a rampant growth
I like it for my taniwha deck. Gives me something to do on my upkeep
man, a maze that taps for mana and finds you lans

7 you say...why hello there, Maelstrom Wanderer...
This isn't notable other than someone from the Pittsburgh Pirates spoiled it, so that's cool
Overflowing Insight is still probably worse than Recurring insight most of the time. I guess it being targeted has uses.

Just because it's worse, does that mean it doesn't get consideration? I'm actually curious. Can decks not afford two of these spells? Or would you rather have Recurring Insight and then X cost draws?
Not trying to argue, lol
IMO two is too much, but that's me
I guess it depends on color combos too, etc.
As always, depends on the deck. Maelstrom Wanderer probably likes this. My Kruphix deck won't touch it. Sorcery speed is a more important factor than the ability.
Yeah, makes total sense in Wanderer
Jeleva maybe
Mizzix probably has enough x draw options that it's not worth losing the flexibility
Depends if you build Mizzix with X-spells...some like to win via his mastery, so the minimize the X spells
Draw 7 card is bad imo. Need something with more flex. Might rather play [[stroke of genius]]

To mason's more specific question, I'm usually of the school of thought that duplicate cards for powerful effects are totally worth it (running mana reflection AND zendikar resurgent, for example). A buddy of mine is the opposite, he prefers the single most powerful card for each effect. Comes down to consistency vs variety
I guess it depends on the effect, but I tend to agree.
itâs about what you want to do with the deck, what youâre worried about losing to
Plus there's some OCD factors. It would hurt my brain running Cultivate without Kodama's Reach or Swords without Path
And obviously he only does it for the big spells. He runs cultivate and kodamas, obviously. But he only wants one craterhoof behemoth effect, for example, not a half dozen overrun cards.
you would dislike my meren rats list then dana
no cultivate, but there is a kodama
Yep, that would make me twitch  :slightly_smiling_face:
This leads to the overall deckbuilding discussion. The problem with only running 'good' cards, is your decks tend to start looking the same no matter the commander.
I only need the one though, because Iâm at 3 mana already, itâd get me to 5
those are the two peaks of my deck, and frankly drawing the second copy of it is terrible

<@U3L7A68JC> That's one of the reasons I tend to enforce deck building rules for specific decks. I have quite a few green decks, so by setting a rule of no non-enchantment ramp in Sigarda and no non-artifact ramp in Glissa I have two green decks not running any Cultivate-type effects.
There's only so many work-arounds like that though
my only rules for deck building tend to be âwhat kind of annoying is this deck?â
if itâs the kind where the table is bored, then I need to change the deck
if itâs one where I am giggleing to myself because Iâm forceing everyone to problem solve something, it stays

Ok now they're there.
What happens if I cast Increasing Vengeance from the graveyard and then copy it?
You're copying what's on the stack so I'd think you'd only get a single additional copy, but I could be wrong.
IOW, you'd get 3 copies of the spell vs 4...
I think... Um. Does Swarm Intelligence and Increasing Vengeance from the yard go infinite?
Yea, I agree with you guys, Rudy just seems like he's trying to be JUUUUUST obnoxious enough that people will think he's funny but he's not.
<@U340CHVJA>
You're a judgr
Judge
Dean you're getting into some next level stuff
No - swarm is a cast trigger and you aren't casting copied spells.
Ah
That's fine.
I think it still goes infinite
So you'd get Increasing copied but I think it's the same thing - you'd get the original spell copied and we're at 3, but that's my logical breakdown vs a judges ruling.
Hi I'm tagged what's going on?
I have Swarm Intelligence and Kess on the board. I cast Torment of Hailfire for some arbitrary amount. With Kess I cast Increasing Vengeance from the yard.
I get a copy from Swarm
Yes
Is the copy the better effect?
If yes, can I keep on targeting the original Increasing Vengeance for the double copies?
Ummm ok so I'm pretty sure it's not the better effect cause that'll check on resolution
And see it's a copy
Damn
But either way
If you get the copy
Well, sure.
I'm going to win
Target the original
Get another copy
I just wanted to know if I could make infinite Increasing Vengeance copies and then send them all at Torment.
You can sorta do that loop for however long
Ummm
Hmm
Right?
Yeah
It goes infinite, yeah?
So you can just loop any two copy spells off each other
By since the copies aren't being cast you're just spinning wheels for no apparent reason
Storm count a million
Oh no.. M
Damn
A copy of increasing vengeance is created on the stack and as such will never be able to be bonus
No storm checks cast spells
Same reason storm copies don't help your storm count
Right. Swarm is a cast trigger so it wouldn't trigger off the copy to keep the chain going.
Well, that too
I'm just saying let's say I have a reverberate in the stack targeting anything
And cast another reverberate
Targeting reverberate
I can just use the copies to target the original any amount of times
But am not accomplishing anything ever
No cards I'm aware of check for spells that have been copied not cast
I'm disappointed that the copies don't double the spell
Lol sorry
Not your fault.
Stupid rules.
Dean just wants a winmore situation.
:stuck_out_tongue_winking_eye:
